title: Why do most people not know about Portuguese history? - Quora

response.answer_text: Most people know two histories: that of their own country, which they learnt at school, and that of the country currently dominating the mass media. I know South African history, and I know about the Alamo because I saw the movie. I don't know Portuguese history. But I don't know the history of a lot of places. Korea, Azerbaijan, Costa Rica ... What makes Portugal so special that the entire world should know its history?

A2A.  Way outside my area of expertise, but I'll give my opinion.  First, people not only know little about Portuguese history but also history in general.  Second, in the end, Portugal had limited influence as a colonial power--history tends to focus on the strong colonial powers.
